H0.text: Longer seasons would reduce the sizes of some ecosystems because of the darkening of the sky caused by dust blown into the upper atmosphere by the meteorite impact.

H1.text: Accelerated erosion would have reduced the sizes of some ecosystems, according to the hypothesis that the mass extinction of dinosaurs was caused by the impact of a large meteorite on Earth, which would have caused a darkening of the sky due to dust blown into the upper atmosphere.

H2.text: Reduced photosynthesis would reduce the sizes of some ecosystems following the meteorite impact that darkened the sky by dust, an event scientists believe caused the dinosaurs' mass extinction.

H3.text: Increased number of hurricanes caused the reduction in the sizes of some ecosystems due to the darkening of the sky from dust blown into the upper atmosphere by the impact of a large meteorite on Earth.

A4.text: Then an impact event occurred, causing collapses in photosynthesis-based food chains, both in the already-stressed terrestrial food chains and in the marine food chains.
